channel.title: web://❤
channel.description: A web related blog by Christian Engel

item.title: Strapi quirks you should know about
item.description: When I first came across Strapi, I had some misconceptions about it which are not immediately clear when reading about the framework in their docs.
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: A typed event system for Typescript
item.description: I wrote a simple, typed event emitter/subscriber system on the weekend.
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: Access denied for 'root'@'localhost'
item.description: MySQL won't let me authenticate as root user through an SSH tunnel in dbeaver.
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: Media Query organization in SASS
item.description: SASS makes working with media queries / breakpoints easy, if you apply this pattern
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: The Redirect Response pattern
item.description: Using HTTP callbacks with your API gives interesting possibilities to reduce client side javascript.
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: Introducing and using Obsidian
item.description: I discovered a valuable note-taking app I want to share with you
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: Mocking modules with jest and typescript
item.description: Since it took me some time to understand the behaviour and the jest docs don't tell much about it, I wanted to write down how to mock modules with jest and especially update the return values of module functions across your tests.
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: The new old school
item.description: My blog is finally online again. This time as a statically generated page. Here is how I made it.
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: Updates about react hook router
item.description: It's been about a month, since I released my initial version of hookrouter. Lots of things happened since then.
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: Modern and clean routing with hooks
item.description: A quick experiment about using hooks for routing in a react app turned out to be very flexible and powerful.
item.author: Christian Engel

item.title: Create a react component as npm module
item.description: There are a lot of guides out there that advise you to use webpack to wrap up your components before publishing them to npm. This is absolutely not necessary. I would even consider it bad practice. Its much easier without webpack, too.
item.author: Christian Engel
